intro: Polysphaeria ovata, commonly known as the oval sphaeria, is a unique member of the sphaeriaceae family. It is a small, aquatic plant characterized by its distinctive, spherical spores that are often found in freshwater environments. The plant typically grows in slow-moving or still water, where it attaches to submerged surfaces. Its morphology is simple, consisting of a stalk with a single spore at the apex. Polysphaeria ovata plays a minor but important role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the microbial food web.
